xxl.core.predicates
Class DistanceWithin<P>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.predicates.AbstractPredicate<P>
      xxl.core.predicates.DistanceWithin<P>
Type Parameters:
P - the type of the predicate's parameters.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, Predicate<P>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DistanceWithinEuclidean, DistanceWithinMaximum
public class DistanceWithin<P>
extends AbstractPredicate<P>

This class provides a binary predicate that determines whether the distance between two given objects is less or equal a given epsilon distance. For determining the distance between two objects, a distance function must be specified during the creation of the predicate.

Assuming that the object A to be processed implements the DistanceTo<A> interface, the required distance function can be ascribed to this functionality shown in the following listing: 

   new DistanceWithin(
       new Distance() {
           public double distance(A a1, A a2) {
               return a1.distanceTo(a2);
           }
       },
       0.5
   );

See Also:
Distance, DistanceTo, Serialized Form

Field Detail

distance

protected Distance<? super P> distance
The distance function that should be used for determining the distance between two objects.

epsilon

protected double epsilon
The epsilon distance represents the maximum distance between two objects such that the predicate returns true. In other words, the predicate returns true if the result of the distance function is less or equal the given epsilon distance.

Constructor Detail

DistanceWithin

public DistanceWithin(Distance<? super P> distance,
                      double epsilon)
Creates a new binary predicate that determines whether the distance between two given objects is within a specified epsilon distance.

Parameters:
distance - the distance function that should be used for determining the distance between two objects.
epsilon - the double value represents the maximum distance between two objects such that the predicate returns true.
Method Detail

invoke

public boolean invoke(P argument0,
                      P argument1)
Returns whether the first specified object lies within an epsilon distance of the second specified object. In other words, determine the distance between the given objects and returns true if this distance is less or equal the given epsilon distance.

Specified by:
invoke in interface Predicate<P>
Overrides:
invoke in class AbstractPredicate<P>
Parameters:
argument0 - the object which epsilon distance should be regarded.
argument1 - the object that should be tested whether it lies within the epsilon distance of the first object.
Returns:
true if the second object lies within the epsilon distance of the first object, otherwise false.
